content: nautilus 1954 is a washington-based & growing community of knitters and crocheters that have taken the mission to express gratitude and love to our united states navy submarine fleet through handknit & crocheted wool hats find us on facebook nautilus1954 & instagram @nautilus_1954 for more information giving tuesday hat yarn requirements 50 100g dk worsted weight 100% superwash wool needles us 6 us 7 16 circular needles or size to create desired fabric finished size adult skull cap one size fits most *optional modifications for a beanie and/or a folded brim abbreviations sts stitches k knit p purl k2tog knit 2 stitches together p2tog purl 2 stitches together pattern with us 6 us 7 cast on 112 96 stitches place marker and join for working in the round being careful to not twist the stitches body knit 2 x 2 rib for 7 for beanie or 10 for folded brim decreases round 1 *k2 p2tog k2 p2* repeat until end of round 98 84 sts remain round 2 *k2 p1 k2 p2* repeat until end of round round 3 *k2 p1 k2 p2tog* repeat until end of round 84 72 sts remain round 4 *k2 p1* repeat until end of round round 5 *k2 k2tog k1 p1* repeat until end of round 70 60 sts remain round 6 *k4 p1* repeat until end of round round 7 *k3 k2tog* repeat until end of round 56 48 sts remain round 8 knit all stitches round 9 *k2 k2tog* repeat until end of round 42 36 sts remain round 10 knit all stitches round 11 *k1 k2tog* repeat until end of round 28 24 sts remain round 12 knit all stitches round 13 *k2tog* repeat until end of round 14 12 sts remain round 14 knit all stitches round 15 *k2tog* repeat until end of round 7 6 sts remain round 16 knit all stitches finishing break yarn and secure by threading the long tail through all remaining stitches twice and pull tail snug to close the top of the cap block & weave in ends
